post.body:
I recently created a NSFW guild, but as I'm posting in it, all of the posts are showing up in the new feed for all users to see.

In theory this should be OK, but in practice there may be multiple dozens of posts per day in the guild. If this shows for everyone then the New feed would be FLOODED with NSFW content, to the exclusion of all else. 

I would like to have an option so that only people who are specifically looking for the content will see it.  This is just to be polite to the other users and not force them to see graphic NSFW content when browsing New.
post.body_html:
I recently created a NSFW guild, but as I'm posting in it, all of the posts are showing up in the new feed for all users to see.

In theory this should be OK, but in practice there may be multiple dozens of posts per day in the guild. If this shows for everyone then the New feed would be FLOODED with NSFW content, to the exclusion of all else.

I would like to have an option so that only people who are specifically looking for the content will see it. This is just to be polite to the other users and not force them to see graphic NSFW content when browsing New.
post.title: Suggestion: Allow guild master the option to hide posts in guild from the "New" feed, especially for NSFW subreddits

body:
Getting rid of the Discord. Discord is an even worse platform than reddit where every single employee is an extreme SJW furry. It also has shady requirements, like how it now needs you to attach your phone number to not get your account banned immediately. On top of that, the corrupt staff bans a ton of people for the worst reasons, the most infamous of which is criticizing or making fun of furries (yes, *really*). I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. They have always refused to make anyone a mod of the server, nor did they ever discuss anything about their plans for the server itself outside of their private mod channel. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. Those mods have tried to get the admins to add other mods who showed an interest in it but they've consistently refused. The admins also claimed that they were going to make it possible to become a mod, but it's taken them way too long so I'm convinced that it's not happening.

post.body:
There's a post claiming that Ruqqus has some kind of quarantine, fortunately the explanation is rather more mundane. Note that I have no affiliation with Ruqqus other than being a poster, and browsing the source code out of interest. 

This is a quick look in the source code that's responsible for filtering out offensive content, and shows how transparent the process actually is. 

1. When generating the user feed, a property of the currently active user is checked to determine whether or not they want to see offensive content. The default is not, and looks to be done so as to filter it for non-authenticated users. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/front.py#L71)

2. This flag can be changed via the user settings form, it's a simple checkbox. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/settings.py#L38)

3. New submissions are categorised whether they're offensive by being checked against a list of slurs; if they find a match then they're flagged as offensive. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/0696d5420fcd9c12fd91a3ea3d98cb0291942492/ruqqus/routes/posts.py#L372)

4. The list of slurs is surprisingly short - and is mainly pertaining to racism. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/assets/slurs.txt) 

5. The slurs file is also accessible directly from the user profile page; it's not hidden or guarded in anyway. [source](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/42ceb7f320deec304816a5729bdeb4456fbeb006/ruqqus/templates/settings_profile.html)

Whether you agree with it or not, its hardly quarantining. Everyone still has a voice and the ability to post their content, just everyone has an option to avoid it too. If I recall correctly, this is actually an implementation of something that was discussed in this guild.
post.body_html:
There's a post claiming that Ruqqus has some kind of quarantine, fortunately the explanation is rather more mundane. Note that I have no affiliation with Ruqqus other than being a poster, and browsing the source code out of interest.

This is a quick look in the source code that's responsible for filtering out offensive content, and shows how transparent the process actually is.

  1. When generating the user feed, a property of the currently active user is checked to determine whether or not they want to see offensive content. The default is not, and looks to be done so as to filter it for non-authenticated users. source

  2. This flag can be changed via the user settings form, it's a simple checkbox. source

  3. New submissions are categorised whether they're offensive by being checked against a list of slurs; if they find a match then they're flagged as offensive. source

  4. The list of slurs is surprisingly short - and is mainly pertaining to racism. source

  5. The slurs file is also accessible directly from the user profile page; it's not hidden or guarded in anyway. source

Whether you agree with it or not, its hardly quarantining. Everyone still has a voice and the ability to post their content, just everyone has an option to avoid it too. If I recall correctly, this is actually an implementation of something that was discussed in this guild.
post.title: Ruqqus doesn't have quarantine - a short look at the source

body:
It takes time to catch on to what they like. Most redditors aren't intelligent enough to understand the better material, so they denounce it as "trolling" and downvote and ban those users, while the normie stuff is upvoted to the top. When I first joined almost everything I posted got lots of downvotes and rude replies. Just 100 upvotes was very high for me back then. I even had at least one stalker downvote everything I posted immediately (probably using a bot since it was watching me 24/7, and the funniest part is they were stupid enough to make their votes public so I discovered them a year later). A lot of times, the lamer the better.

And as far as commenting goes, you need to sort by rising/new (the latter requires a bit of judgement) so you get the first few comments before the post blows up. The way the sorting algorithm works is that new comments are immediately buried at the bottom and never seen, and the ones that already have upvotes remain mostly in place.

body:
Reposted from an explanation I made in another thread:

> Discord is an even worse platform than reddit where every single employee is an extreme SJW furry. It also has shady requirements, like how it now needs you to attach your phone number to not get your account banned immediately. On top of that, the corrupt staff bans a ton of people for the worst reasons, the most infamous of which is criticizing or making fun of furries (yes, *really*). I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

> The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. They have always refused to make anyone a mod of the server, nor did they ever discuss anything about their plans for the server itself outside of their private mod channel. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. Those mods have tried to get the admins to add other mods who showed an interest in it but they've consistently refused. The admins also claimed that they were going to make it possible to become a mod, but it's taken them way too long so I'm convinced that it's not happening.

I complain about this way too much and if you want to find out more just look at my post and comment history and you'll find more than enough information about this.
body_html:
Reposted from an explanation I made in another thread:

Discord is an even worse platform than reddit where every single employee is an extreme SJW furry. It also has shady requirements, like how it now needs you to attach your phone number to not get your account banned immediately. On top of that, the corrupt staff bans a ton of people for the worst reasons, the most infamous of which is criticizing or making fun of furries (yes, really). I've never heard of a Discord ban getting lifted before, and seeing how banned accounts show up as deleted I doubt it's even possible for Discord to reverse one (Discord apparently doesn't hold on to deleted content like most platforms). So if someone gets banned or doesn't want to share their phone number, they can't join the Ruqqus Discord. This is very bad because right now Ruqqus literally relies on the discord for all DMs and 99% of information and announcements.

The other problem is how the admins are not communicating with users at all when it comes to how the server is set up. They have always refused to make anyone a mod of the server, nor did they ever discuss anything about their plans for the server itself outside of their private mod channel. A few weeks ago the admins finally added a few mods because the rapid influx during reddit's banwave forced them to. But now the situation is arguably even worse than before, because now the few non-admins who were modded then have a lot of control over the server, but the admins still refuse to add anyone else as a mod or discuss plans and changes for the server with anyone except those mods, meaning < 10 users have input and everyone else probably doesn't even know about what the plans are. Those mods have tried to get the admins to add other mods who showed an interest in it but they've consistently refused. The admins also claimed that they were going to make it possible to become a mod, but it's taken them way too long so I'm convinced that it's not happening.

I complain about this way too much and if you want to find out more just look at my post and comment history and you'll find more than enough information about this.

body:
Discord itself bans a bunch of people and servers it doesn't like, so they have to enforce all kinds of crazy rules there. On top of that, the admins here refuse to communicate anything about moderation of the server with its users, including adding new mods. The only mods that exist where added during a massive influx of users and the admins had no choice. Now the admins still refuse to discuss any plans for the server with anyone except those few mods in their private mod channel. They also still refuse to welcome new mods, so that means now those < 10 current mods have total control and input on how the server is run and no one else even knows anything, let alone has a say. The current mods tried to get the admins to add other people who were interested in being a mod there but they've consistently refused.

I literally wasn't even in the server until 2 days ago and I've been hearing about this non-stop since /u/spez banned everything from reddit and triggered the influx here.

body: Honestly, I feel like Ruqqus is the only reddit alternative that *isn't* imply a clone of reddit. It genuinely has an appeal to more than just reddit refugees, even though they are a large part of its userbase. Reddit was that way compared to Digg initially. That's why I think Ruqqus is the one that's most likely to succeed at the moment.

post.body:
Ruqqus isn't very similar to Reddit if we're being honest, so labeling it as an alternative isn't a very smart marketing tactic, in my opinion. Instead, it should be advertised as a new website: it has free speech, no censorship, vast opinions - all things that Reddit is missing, so saying Ruqqus is a Reddit alternative is dumb because it's saying it, too, doesn't have free speech, it has censorship and doesn't have pluralistic ideas, which, if you've browsed both Ruqqus and Reddit lately, you'll come to the realization that that's just not true.

Also, comparing yourself to Reddit and talking about how terrible Reddit is all the time gets very boring, very fast - at least that's how it was for me. At first, I was like, yeah, Reddit sucks, fellow Ruqqies, but now, after it's been a while, it's just boring and annoying seeing the same "orange website bad" memes and posts - it's like seeing the front page of Reddit, except "orange man bad", is replaced with "orange website bad". 

That's it, thanks for reading, please mention Reddit less, and promote hobby related guilds more!

Also, comparing yourself to Reddit and talking about how terrible Reddit is all the time gets very boring, very fast - at least that's how it was for me. At first, I was like, yeah, Reddit sucks, fellow Ruqqies, but now, after it's been a while, it's just boring and annoying seeing the same "orange website bad" memes and posts - it's like seeing the front page of Reddit, except "orange man bad", is replaced with "orange website bad".

That's it, thanks for reading, please mention Reddit less, and promote hobby related guilds more!

post.body: I saw [this suggestion](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/issues/283) on Github but I haven't been able to find any official statement about federation. I'm sure there are plenty of people who would like to see this added for the reasons described in that Github issue. Although I have no experience with implementing federation, I am a developer who's willing to contribute to a branch that focuses on that.
